page.title: 06Sebergham trade & transport
page.content: The area is crossed by two main roads though neither is very busy. The Penrith to Wigton route across the North East corner carries goods from and to Silloth and Wigton from all parts of the country. Local traffic comprises farm feeds and stock move- ment to and from local markets. Cattle imported from Ireland through Silloth docks pass through at certain times of the year. There is now only one bus a week on market day to the local town of Wigton However mobile shops visit the village on three days a week. A grocer and a baker visit twice and a butcher once. Parkhead Limestone Quarry is at present open and run by a company from the North East of England. A small tonnage of stone is processed and used by farmers and contractors for road building.
